pros: Friendly and caring management. Happy residents and family members. Great company values
cons: Scheduling could be more flexible especially for students

pros: Generally decent pt to nurse ratio, friendly management, the nurses and cenas are nice, 8 or 12 hour shifts,  they work with you on your schedule, staff works well and helps each other, usually finish your work on time or about a half hour after shift unless there's lots of admits then you may have to stay over later.  Clean,  treats employees with respect, Good pay.  These are tough times in the medical field and I think they are doing well to keep it together.  I would recommend working here.
cons: The cons are the same with any nursing home rehab. Sometimes people call off and we are short staffed. Normally it's good though. They can also get a ton of admits on the same day making the workload difficult. I think there's enough work to do with no admits. Maybe an admission nurse would be nice.  That being said that's the way it is all over and just part of nursing life.
